value.title: Import images in Power BI from local sources
value.excerpt: In todays video I will show you how to import images in Power BI with the help of SQL Jason.  He shows in his blog post how you can import images in Power BI from your local folder for offline use. Read more about it here: http://sqljason.com/2018/01/embedding-images-in-power-bi-using-base64.html  and

value.title: Insert blank rows at each category in Power Query
value.excerpt: Have you ever wanted to have a blank row after each category or subcategory, so you can visualize your data in a table?   In this video I will show you how to add a blank row for each group using power query in one step!  Enjoy!  Here you can download all the pbix files: https://curbal.com/donwload-center

value.title: Lookup values from the same table in Power Query

value.title: Managing changing column names in Power Query #10: (M)agic (M)ondays
value.excerpt: In today's video, I will show how to manage column headers that changes names so your power bi file does not break when you refresh it.  This tip is from Lars Schreiber and here is the link to his blog post and how to do this in power query: http://power-bi-usergroup.blogspot.se/2015/12/dealing-with-tables-with-changing.html

value.title: Refresh Power BI every second or minute!
value.excerpt: In today's video I am going to show you how to refresh Power BI every minute or any interval you yet :). value.title: Running totals in power query??? Yes, you can :)

Also, I will show you how List.Range work, really cool function :)  Here you can download all the pbix files: https://curbal.com/donwload-center

value.title: Automatically Send Power BI Report as PDF or PPT format in Email
value.excerpt: During this session, we will learn how we can automatically send our Power BI Report as PDF or PPT format in Email. We all know about Email Subscription functionality in Power BI. value.title: Forecasting in Power BI
value.excerpt: In this video, we will learn how we can forecast our data in Power BI. We will be discussing which visualization supports forecasting in Power BI. We can perform forecasting with a Line chart in Power BI.  In this video, we have taken an example of a real-life scenario to forecast our data.  Stay Connected
